page.title: 05HOUGHTON HALL - REPLACEMENTS
page.content: The decoration of the interior is largely as it was at the time of Robert Walpole.The removal of the pictures resulted in some alterations after the house came through the female line to the Cholmondeley family on the death of Horace Walpole in 1797.In the CABINET ROOM, the original hangings were replaced with Chinese hand painted wallpaper.The fourth EARL of CHOLMONDELEY created MARQUESS in 1815, was a great friend of the PRINCE REGENT who gave specially woven silk hangings from SPITALFIELDS for walls and curtains, a new carpet , probably WILTON,and English furniture with woven tapestry covers for the re-decoration of the present WHITE DRAWING ROOM.The chandelier supplied by PARKER &PERRYof LONDON dates from about 18O5.
